meanings.definition: In spite of the fact that; even though.
meanings.sent1: Although it rained, we still had fun at the park.
meanings.sent2: I wanted to go for a walk, although it was getting dark outside.
meanings.sent3: Although the cat tried to act tough, it was scared of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The flower bloomed beautifully, although it had been neglected for weeks.
meanings.sent5: Although the cake looked delicious, it tasted terrible.

meanings.sent1: I wanted to go for a run, although I was feeling tired.
meanings.sent2: She was busy with work, although she managed to find time for a quick break.
meanings.sent3: Although the movie was boring, she stayed until the end out of politeness.
meanings.sent4: The team lost the game, although they had practiced hard all week.
meanings.sent5: Although the book was long, she finished reading it in one sitting.
